title: I want to file bankruptcy but I am an illegal alien. Will I have problems?
question: I am an illegal alien. I have lots of credit card debt I incurred under a fake social. But I have an itn number. What concerns should I have if I file bankruptcy?
answers: As long as you disclose both the fake social security number and the valid ITINN you are good. There is no citizenship requirement for filing bankruptcy. Make sure you have an accurate list of your debts that you inccured with the fake social

I have filed several bankruptcy petitions for debtors who used false social security numbers in the past, but who filed under a legitimate social security or itn number. In Orange County (Santa Ana), the debtors were denied a discharge. In Los Angeles County, I have never had a problem provided the information was disclosed up front.

Let me see if I got this straight:
You are not in the US legally, you broke several US laws obtaining and presenting as your own a SS# that was not, you borrowed money under false pretenses from a lot of people who ARE here legally, and now you want the US government to relieve you of all that debt.
What do YOU think?

Allot, filing bankruptcy would be an admission of identity theft and fraud.

You can file using your ITN without problems. The fake Social Security Number may be an issue for you in the bankruptcy. Since you did not have a legal right to work in the USA, you lied to the lender regarding your ability to repay the debt. Secondly, Using a fake SSN is a form of fraud.
The issue may arise at your meeting of creditors and If you are questioned regarding the fake number. You and your attorney should discuss this at your first meeting and again prior to the meeting of creditors so that both of you are on the alert for those questions and are prepared with answers or otherwise.
It is very important that you do not try to do this on your own.

Do you know whether the fake social security number matched one that belonged to a real person or if it was a number that was not issued to anyone else?

You could have problems in either event and I have heard of ICE agents showing up to bankruptcy meetings. However, the policy of the US Attorney and the US Trustee in many districts is to ignore filings by illegal aliens if the SSN associated with the debt does not belong to a real citizen. In many Districts it would just be too much work to address the immigration status of every bankruptcy filer. You should work with an experienced bankruptcy attorney who can advise you about the risks you take in filing for bankruptcy protection

On the other hand, if your fake social security number matches a real person, you have screwed up the credit of a real person through your false credit applications you can expect much more effort to prosecute you, send you to jail, and then deport you.

Anyone is eligible to obtain protection under the bankruptcy code as long as you reside or are domiciled in or have property or a business in the USA. Whether you have legal status or not is irrelevant to one's eligibility to seek bankruptcy protection.

You are NOT required to have a SSN to file, but you should use your ITN. Be sure to use your ITN on your "Statement of Social Security Number."

Now, about that fake social security number - that may be a problem for you in bankruptcy and otherwise. When you put that fake SSN on the credit application, you swore two things to the credit grantor (a) you had a legal right to work in the USA; and (b) whatever credit report came up when they ran that SSN was yours.

Since you don't have a legal right to work in the USA, you lied to the credit grantor. Most likely, whatever credit was associated with the fake SSN you provided was better than your real credit history, which was a second lie to the credit grantor. Either of these lies may be sufficient grounds to revoke your right to a discharge of that debt or all debts.

I have not seen this situation enough to know how the judge or creditor will respond.

Good luck.
